entry.title: Book Making Test
entry.content: “That must be the Emerald City,” said Dorothy. As they walked on, the green glow became brighter and brighter,<!–more–> and it seemed that at last they were nearing the end of their travels.The same secludedness and isolation to which the schoolmaster whale betakes himself in his advancing years, is true of all aged Sperm Whales. Almost universally, a lone whale—as a solitary Leviathan is called—proves an ancient one. Like venerable moss-bearded Daniel Boone, he will have no one near him but Nature herself; and her he takes to wife in the wilderness of waters, and the best of wives she is, though she keeps so many moody secrets.
entry.summary: “That must be the Emerald City,” said Dorothy. As they walked on, the green glow became brighter and brighter,

entry.title: Monogram Stamp & Stationary
entry.content:
Do you love the special touch of a handwritten note? Do you have pen-pals who celebrates paper-craft? Create and send memorable stationary made with your personal monogram.

We will explore:

  • Printmaking techniques
  • Patterns

We will make:

  • A personal, monogram stamp (unmounted) (~ 2 ¼ in. x 2 ¼ in.)
  • A set of ten (10) personalized monogram stationary and matching baronial envelopes. (A6 Cards - 6 ¼ in. x 4 ⅝ in. folded)

Materials You Keep ($25 - included in total price):

  • Stamp carving tool (Speedball No.1 Lino Cutter Assortment with five cutters.)
  • Carving block
  • Stonehenge Pure Cotton Paper

✔Before the Workshop:

  • Choose a letter you would like to carve into a stamp. We’ve put together a document with some great numbered samples. Please send us an email with your letter selection (e.g. A1, J6, etc.) Feel free to find or create your own letter as well. Keep the letter size with a 2 ¼ in. x 2 ¼ in. square to properly fit your carving block and card.
entry.summary:
Do you love the special touch of a handwritten note? Do you have pen-pals who celebrates paper-craft? Create and send memorable stationary made with your personal monogram.
We will explore:
Printmaking techniques Patterns
We will make:
A personal, monogram stamp (unmounted) (~ 2 ¼ in. x 2 ¼ in.) A set of ten (10) personalized monogram stationary and matching baronial envelopes. (A6 Cards - 6 ¼ in. x 4 ⅝ in. folded)
Materials You Keep ($25 - included in total price):
Stamp carving tool (Speedball No.1 Lino Cutter Assortment with five cutters.) Carving block Stonehenge Pure Cotton Paper
✔Before the Workshop:
Choose a letter you would like to carve into a stamp. We’ve put together a document with some great numbered samples. Please send us an email with your letter selection (e.g. A1, J6, etc.) Feel free to find or create your own letter as well. Keep the letter size with a 2 ¼ in. x 2 ¼ in. square to properly fit your carving block and card.

entry.title: Monogram Stamp & Stationary
entry.content:
Welcome to the Monogram Stamp & Stationary workshop. You will be hand-carving a stamp featuring the letter(s) of your choice and applying said stamp to build a personalized set of monogram stationary. This is a great project for yourself or as a gift for your pen-pal family and friends.

You leave with:

  • Set of Ten Personalized Monogram Stationary with Envelopes
  • Your Hand-carved Monogram Stamp
  • Carving tools
  • Stamp Resource Guide (Digital) with guality links to continue exploring stamp making
Cost of Materials: $25 Requirements: None
entry.summary:
Welcome to the Monogram Stamp & Stationary workshop. You will be hand-carving a stamp featuring the letter(s) of your choice and applying said stamp to build a personalized set of monogram stationary. This is a great project for yourself or as a gift for your pen-pal family and friends.
You leave with:
Set of Ten Personalized Monogram Stationary with Envelopes Your Hand-carved Monogram Stamp Carving tools Stamp Resource Guide (Digital) with guality links to continue exploring stamp making
Cost of Materials: $25 Requirements: None
